history.content:
I believe it is mandatory to form a group. Whether it is or not, it is extremely recommended. You will have a chance to form groups in the beginning of class (start posting and reaching out early for the best chances of good groupmates).

I took CS162 last summer. It was the only class I took that summer. I had a group of 3 people for the first 2 projects and another person joined for the last project. It was like working a full-time job when projects were in progress; we basically met from noon to late evening every day for 1.5-2 weeks per project. Everybody contributed and we had no slackers. I personally have a very good track record in CS classes and alot of experience; this is not to brag, but to point out that the workload is exhausting even for someone who is capable of getting good grades.

I'd say if you somehow took CS162 as the only class during a regular semester it would be pretty doable without a group; taking it during the summer is not.

children.subject:
Good luck! They might force you to form a group, but if they don't and you manage to do it alone I'll be seriously impressed and I'll buy you a boba (or a sandwich or something if you don't like boba). Even if you decide to join a group later on I'll still do it just for having the cojones to try.

In my semester we had a competition called LogPorts which separated us into houses like HogWarts and the winning house was supposed to get extra credit and $5 "so you can buy boba!" they said but winners were never announced. I even entered their art contest to draw the next semester's logo. This is my Doofenshmirtz-esque villain origin story.

I set this post to non-anonymous, not sure if it'll help you find me later. I'll try to check this post again after the summer is over.
lol, I'll definitely try my best for that boba.
thank you for the advice! but I kind of want to do it alone, I guess I'll be starting it early then.

history.content: Is it mandatory to form a group?
history.subject: Can cs162 be done alone during the summer?
